subject: Home Again
event:
An endless day of travel yesterday.  Most of it pretty good, but exhaustion did catch up with me during the last few hours, especially when American Eagle kept delaying the last leg of our journey, from Chicago to Albuquerque.

Our last day in Slovenia was wonderful.  Our hosts took us up to Bled, and showed us a couple of castles and a magnificient Victorian era hotel right on the lake, where I really want to stay some time.  Our genial host was the mayor of Bled, who regaled us with all the wonderful tales of his town and region.  And I was given some truly gorgeous gifts...

Then we had lunch at Marshall Tito's villa before returning to the airport and flying back to Warsaw (by way of Munich!).  Overnight at the Warsaw airport Marriott, the off to Chicago and the next morning.  We shared the Marriott with some kind of wheelchair fencing championship, which made for some colorful sights as we were leaving.

A great trip.  You Slovenian and Polish fans are wonderful.  Thanks for everything.

Now I would like to sleep for a week... but alas, I can't.  Too much work to do.  

So back to it.

comments.article: Glad you enjoyed your visit, however difficult it may have been. There were quite a few of us pretty glad you made the trip :)

Welcome home.

Your blog may have given Eastern European tourism a boost. I know I would like to go now.
Oh I loved Bled. We actually swam across to the church on the small island and back the two days we were there. Gorgeous place!

I KNEW they would take you to Bled, the trip just wouldn't be perfect without it. :) I hope they served you a kremsnita (cream slice).
Now please get some rest. I feel kinda guilty for being one of those who tortured you last thursday in Ljubljana. :)

Hi, I was wondering if you'd be coming over to Ireland anytime in the next few months with the filming of season 2 of the show, I'd love to meet you walking round Belfast someday. (Well if you are traveling over I hope you're well rested before the long flights)

how do you have the stamina to fly so much?  Do you always go First Class?  Does Ty deal with all the bags and such?  I get so exhausted just from the actual plane ride, I don't see how you do it so often. I guess if I were in first class and had more leg room and ability to get up and stretch my legs maybe, but as much as you travel even that wouldn't help.
comments.subject: How do you do it?

comments.article:
You need to do even more travelling.  
It may tire the body but it energizes the soul.  
Take BIG BITES.

comments.upictitle: Bryon Blofstein: cosplay BANE Batman c2e2
comments.article: I heard that you bumped into some friends of mine at the airport in Chicago.  They said you were surprised to recognized.  My one friend mentioned she thanked you "for being awesome"!  You also offered them to continue the conversation on the tram!  You sir, are a genuinely fine person.  I also met you last year at C2E2 in Chicago and I'd like to say the same, thank you for being awesome!
comments.subject: Chicago airport

comments.article: I'm sure Bran Stark would be cheered by a wheelchair fencing tournament.
Rest up. I don't know if you will have the time, but if Charlie Rose comes calling, please come to NY to do the interview.
I stayed at a hostel in Bled for a few days, hell of a nice place. I hope you didnt have to do the hike and a half up to the castle that overlooks the lake. But it sure was worth it
comments.subject: Bled

comments.article: Munich? Awww. I would have come to a quick airport bookstore signing ... :/
comments.subject: Munich?

comments.article: Sorry for the out of place, random question. Did anyone else watch Miss California more or less give a shout out to  Game of Thrones, just ten minutes before being crowned Miss USA? This happened around a week ago, but I didn't find anyone mentioning it at all, so I wasn't sure if it somehow went totally under the radar. I guess it wasn't terribly important, but I thought it was really neat ;)
comments.subject: Random Question

comments.article: I wish u had time to visit Vintgar Gorje , Its in Bled and amazing , Also the caves of Krizna jama (35 kms from postojna) , When I went into these caves (negligible human influence inside) I thought it would look like Valyria if u replace the water with Lava!! XD
comments.subject: Slovenia!!

comments.upictitle: Xray Is As Xray Does: fly!
comments.article: welcome back, traveling madman.
Glad you made it home safely.
And while you were traveling, your publisher obviously got Dance finished and out to Amazon. I just got an email form Amazon.de that they have sent the little dragon off to me. :)
Alas, Amazon.de has lied to you.  No DANCE till July 12.

About actually having sent the book off? That would be a first. I'm used to emails about changed delivery dates of preordered books that turned out to be as wrong as they can get, but if the book isn't in my hot little hands by Thursday at latest, I'll lose what little faith I had left in Amazon.

Well, I'll survive. I haven't finished the reread of the previous books anyway. ;)

Hello Mr Martin,

amazon.de has shipped the book this evening to me also. Now they have the old release date up again on the site, but the whole afternoon it was available to order. Not fair for the rest of the world, but I am selfishly looking forward to reading it tomorrow :-)

Greetings from Germany

Torsten
comments.subject: Release Date

comments.article: If you actually get DANCE tomorrow, Amazon.de is going to be in big, big trouble.
comments.subject: Re: Release Date

comments.article:
According to the Wertzone blog, Bantam has noticed what was going on and locked the dragon den again. But some managed to fly out, and Amazon may not be able to stop the delivery of those in time.

If the little guy gets stuck in Stauffenberg for the next 2 weeks instead of flying all the way to me, we know they did catch it in time. ;)
comments.subject: Re: Release Date

comments.article: Please, come to Russia one day :)

Welcome Home, George!
I just thought I might say a word or two. Have you heard about homeopathic drug No-Jet Lag? It was our life-saver when we traveled to Europe and back and from coast to coast as well. Just chew a pill every two hours during your flights and you won't feel all beat up and well jet-lagged :)
PS. Where have I been all these years?? I've discovered your SONG just two months ago and read all 4 books. And impatiently waiting for DANCE. :)

comments.upictitle: The Same as Any Other: Spider Jerusalem Bunny
comments.article:
I was wondering where I had heard of Bled before...

It was the hometown of the mother of Dance, one of Jem's Holograms.
comments.subject: Not THAT Dance
